This over pressure situation happens at the beginning and end of each cycle.  Not everyone needs this functionality, but everyone in my community (central FL with well and pump) does... and I think a S/W update would fix it.  Also, connecting the device to my wifi was frustrating.  I literally ran through the setup sequence- which did not fully conform to the instructions- over a dozen times before it connected.  I would have quit earlier but my other crappy device (a pet feeder) gave me the same trouble so I stuck it out and just kept trying until it connected.  Recently we lost power for over an hour causing the rain machine to lose connection.  Reconnecting it to wifi again frustrated me nearly to the point of tossing it out.  I‚Äôve had an automatic sprinkler system for many years and this controller is really no better than the previous ones except for the convenience of accessing it through my phone.  I‚Äôm prompted to call it ‚Äòaverage‚Äô.  However given the trouble and frustration it creates, 2 stars is all I‚Äôll give it.

title: Reliability
text: The concept is great regarding the opportunity to remotely control the lawn watering system -  but the WiFi built into the unit is not reliable. I have had the local cable company who services our WiFi come out  several times and the unit continues to fail holding a continual WiFi signal. It is worth the effort to research other similar products within the competitive market before purchasing Rainmaker. They have a 2.8 rating out of 5. title: Poor execution of a good idea
text:
I‚Äôve had the device for over 2 years. It might have been really useful but falls short due to very poor scheduling algorithms. On the surface, they claim to take into account a multitude of parameters like rain amount, evaporation rate, and other factors affecting moisture retention. In reality, the scheduling makes no sense.  I‚Äôm not sure if basic sanity checks were ever done, let alone comprehensive performance testing. Today we got 2.3 inches of rain as recorded by the connected rain gauge. For whatever reason, instead of using the actual measurement they somehow came up with 1.5 in of rain.  Even with that number, one expects that watering should be paused for a while. But no - I have scheduled 150% watering for tomorrow, and 100% two days after that. I had to deactivate the program to prevent this insanity. 
In summary - if you need a device that you can manually control with your phone it will do the trick. If you want to rely on some ‚Äúsmart‚Äù scheduling you are out of luck. Congratulations - you bought yourself an irrigation system remote! This is why I give some credit to the app - not a bad remote and has some graphs too... LOL

title: Could use a lot more enhancements.
text:
Not a basic app but certainly not the advanced application that you would expect considering it's controlling your sprinkler system and the controller itself isn't cheap. 

If you make a change to a zone such as disable "weather adaptive" then you have to step 2 screens deep in that zone and save twice even though you didn't make changes on the 1st screen otherwise your change isn't saved. 

If you water extra by manually starting the saved schedule on the same day it has already run the app won't show that you watered more than 100%. 

You have to take the sprinkler controller off your wifi and connect directly to your smart phone for it to perform a backup so you can restore the latest controller changes in the event of an extended power outage.

The graphs are as basic as it gets.

We have received 3" of rain this evening and the app still shows it will run a full schedule tonight because it hasn't updated any of the enabled weather data servers in 4 hours yet it's WIFI access to the internet hasn't missed a beat and there is no way to force an update. 

This app is in need of many improvements in my opinion.  The sprinkler controller is great but I can't say that about the application unfortunately.

title: Great When It Works
text:

I like the Rain Machine and app when it works, but very frustrating to constantly deal with connectivity issues.  If I have to constantly go to the unit in basement, then I might as well reinstall the original controller (Rain Bird).  It worked fine.  I simply wanted to be able to control sprinklers via my iPhone (and avoid having to go to the basement to change sprinkler settings or activate).  If things do not improve, I probably will install original timer and return the Rain Machine.

Not sure if the issue is tied to a recent firmware update as I installed the unit approximately a week before; however, the connectivity issues started appearing soon after the firmware update.  If Support issues an update and things improve, I will update the ranking and this review.

title: Good product, slightly rough and buggy app UI
text: The wifi config screen in the app crashes every single time but I can work around it using the controller's display. Watering history is hidden under Settings, and the overall interface feels clunky compared to the slick RainMachine marketing materials. This is a good product but the software on the controller is agonizingly slow and the app feels clunky. Hopefully there will be more updates to improve the app soon. Also there is a bug where the dashboard incorrectly highlights the wrong day if you're traveling internationally; this can be fixed if the app is corrected to use the RainMachine's local system time rather than the iPhone's local time for customers who travel overseas or into different time zones.

text: Great app!  Previously golf course super and had a toro irrigation for my lawn at house. Limited system could only water entire lawn not water independent zones. Now have total control. Back lawn is full sun sides and front limited sun. First time I can have multiple programs to cut my water usage down. Central Utah water district paid for my controller. Conservation program they have for wifi weather controllers. Love, love this app!!!  Bought rain sensor too just in case app doesn't shut off on rainy days. It's a hardware item. Love being able to be outside and turn on zone and check sprinklers for problems with my iPhone. Easy to use easy setup. Been waiting for this for years!  Thank you.

title: Needs some work
text:
I like the system quite a bit, it's a big improvement from my old box.  But there needs to be a way to manually update rain amounts.  We got 7" of rain over the weekend and the app only found 2".  To make this system really hands off, one should be able to add info to the app and allow the equation to recalculate based on input. 

It would also be nice if rain needs drops to 10% etc that the system is just "off" - running a zone for 10 seconds is a complete waste.

title: App is somewhat better
text: The app only works on devices that run OS 7 so I can only run it on my iPhone. My old iPad is out. It is so much easier to program. I don't have to keep quitting between every program change and the app runs faster. The update is much appreciated. There are still some small refinements that would be nice like being able to edit the program name without having to delete the old program and making a new one. It would also be nice to be able to reorder the program list. There is one bug that seems to be persistent. If I edit any program it sets all the watering times to AM. I have to delete a program and re-enter all the info. Ease of program editing was one of the features I really wanted. I hope they fix this soon.

title: Poorly-designed app
text: This is one of the most poorly-designed apps for one of the most ingenious devices around. The app is clearly an afterthought. It has trouble making a connection with the rainmaker device reliably on the first attempt when on wifi. It requires very cumbersome port forwarding and IP address discovery for remote use. The interface is a clunky, slow, and inelegant web-based display. And the data do not always reflect the same watering data that are displayed on the rainmaker main screen (especially when low-temperature protection is set). Hint to the developers - check out NEST's interface. A major re-write is definitely and urgently needed. Sadly, the only favorable reviews here are from members of the Rainmaker team, suggesting that they're happy with the app as-is, making their commitment to improving the app seem less likely.

title: Excellent App
text: In response to the reviewer who couldn't see the usefulness in having the device selection page, the ability to select different devices from one central location (and hence one login) is one of the key features of the RainMachine system. I suspect there are more than a few people who have a primary residence and a vacation home. This system enables both to be monitored easily from the same login. It was a key factor in my decision to buy it over the competitors.  The setup is a breeze and it is so user friendly!  Recommend it highly!!

title: Great Produce For Local Network Use
text: Like many of the others here, I cannot get this app to access the RainMachine unit from outside of my network.  The instructions for setup are clear, but all I get is a Network Error.  Looks like the app only forwards https so no matter which port you select 80 or 443, is always employs a secure setting.  There is no way to edit a remote sprinkler, so your only option is to delete a setting entirely and start again.  There is no phone support available at all.  I sent an email request for help, but no response so far.  My ratings reflect the App only and frankly its useless if you cannot access the system outside of your own network.

title: Fine for Programming, Not for History
text:
I like the sprinkler controller itself. Using the app, it's easy to program your sprinkler system and it's nice to be able to turn the zones on as you're walking around your lot without running back and forth to the garage. 

That said, you have to do something with the port forwarding (which I haven't figured out yet) to be able to access the sprinkler system away from home. It doesn't give you any historical information about how long the sprinklers actually ran. One of the main features is that it adjusts based on the amount of rain and temperature, but it doesn't tell you how much each zone actually ran.

title: Brilliant! (But needs improvement)
text:
PROS: 
- The RainMachine hardware is surprisingly easy to install, even for a home-repair-challenged guy like me.
- Quick system setup.
- Instant WiFi connection.
- Beautiful, informative, intuitive app.
- Historical watering data provided.
- System can also be accessed via the Internet.

CONS: 
- The app always opens up to the DEVICE screen and makes you choose which RainMachine device you want to control. (Seriously, how many people actually have more than ONE of these?) This is a totally pointless step. It would be a much better user experience if they would add an option in Settings that allowed us to choose which screen we wanted to see first when we open the app. I can't imagine any homeowner in the world actually WANTING to see this screen. It's waste of time forcing us to "choose" the device every single time we open the app when we only have ONE device! Why not take us directly to the Dashboard screen? We've been asking for this change forever, but they keep ignoring us!
- We shouldn't have to go into Settings to see our Watering History. This really should be another graphical section on the Dashboard screen that we can tap on to see more detailed info. One of the main things we want to see when we quickly pop into this app is, "What have the watering patterns looked like over the past week/month?" Besides, "watering history" is NOT a "Setting" anyway.

The bottom line is, I'm thrilled with this product, and only wish I'd gotten it sooner! The ability to check on my system from anywhere and make whatever schedule changes I want to from my phone is extremely helpful. If you're on the fence about buying this... DO IT! You'll be so glad you did! The developers have been totally unresponsive to communication so far, and that does worry me, but I hope they will fix these problems I've mentioned soon to make this a truly deserving 5-star app.

text:
The app works, mostly, but the entire experience is at best a somewhat ameaturish mess of inconsistent and occasionally glitchy UI.

The Good: The app has never failed to allow me to control my watering system. Even more importantly, so far the watering system itself has worked as advertised.

The Bad: There have been occasions where I needed to forcably close the app to get it to connect or get some piece of the UI unstuck. The UI itself occasionally seems to be missing pieces. (For instance, under Settings > Weather, the app currently tells me I've changed the "field capacity" from it's default, but the app no longer seems to have any UI to change this setting. Also of note, unfortunately this setting itself behaves somewhat oddly and even when set to 1 day will prevent potted plants that need and are otherwise set for daily watering from being watered up to 4 days after the last rain during the winter, when it's colder outside.)

The Ugly: The app really doesn't conform to iOS look and feel, using familiar UI elements that act in very non-iOS ways. Appearance-wise, the app isn't even entirely consistent with itself, using a mess of different font sizes and control styles. Also, the app seems to assume, somewhat strangely, that there's a good change I have multiple Rain Machine devices I want to control, and makes me select my single device from a single-element list every time I open it. None of this affects functionality, but it doesn't exactly reflect well on the quality of work that went into designing the app.
